title: Why isn’t Emmerdale on tonight and when is it back?
text:
We’ll be away from the village until next week (Picture: ITV)

Yes, you read that right – Emmerdale won’t be airing a new episode tonight.

This means that we’ll have to wait until next week to see horrid rapist Lee’s (Kris Mochrie) fate, and how it ultimately impacts Robert Sugden’s (Ryan Hawley) future.

Until then, here’s what you need to know about why the soap won’t be on, and when it’s coming back.

Why isn’t Emmerdale on tonight?

Emmerdale has been bumped from the ITV schedule tonight to make way for the football.

Episodes of both Emmerdale and Corrie have been replaced by games which are part of the UEFA Championship qualifiers.

England will be playing against Czech Republic on Friday 11 October, and on Monday 14 October, England will be taking on Bulgaria.

This means that Emmerdale won’t be hitting our screens again until Tuesday 15 October, when the soap will return with an hour-long episode.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Therefore we’ll have to wait until next week to say goodbye to Robron, who will go on the run together after it’s revealed that Lee died from the injuries that Robert dealt him in a rage.

Emmerdale will next be on on Tuesday 15 October on ITV.

MORE: What’s wrong with Nicola King’s arm on Emmerdale?

description: Yes, you read that right - no new Emmerdale tonight. Here's what you need to know about why the soap won't be on, and when it's coming back.
